intro: Silphium terebinthinaceum var. sinuatum, commonly known as the Sinuous Silphium, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap and lanceolate leaves with a distinctive sinuous margin. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in temperate climates. Silphium terebinthinaceum var. sinuatum is noted for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural resins.
